result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Ryan J Scifo was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J Scifo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order of Discharge Upon Expiration of Commitment
Letter/Transition Plan from Kim Fisher Dane Co. Conditional Release Coordinator
Order for Placement

3:00 pm  Court in sesion.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Defendant Ryan J Scifo in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Kim Fisher, Conditional Release Coordinator, is also present in courtroom
Matter is before the Court to review the proposed conditional release treatment plan.  Atty Hammock has reviewed it with Mr. Scifo and has no objection.  Atty Johnson believes the recommendations are appropriate and has no objection to the proposed plan.  
3:01 pm  Court makes findings and will enter an Order approving the conditional release plan.  
3:02 pm  Court in recess.
Conditional Release Plan
Order for Placement - NGI
NGI
NGI

9:45 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ryan J Scifo in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  
Parties have an agreement.  Defendant will enter a Guilty plea but will be found Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.  Parties agree that Mr. Scifo is appropriate for conditional release and will ask the Court to Order a Conditional Release Plan.  The agreement for the NGI finding is based upon Dr. Rawski's report.  Judge Reddy has not seen that report and asks that he be provided with a copy to review at this time.  
Attorney Johnson makes record that the State has complied with the victim notification law.  
Attorney Johnson indicates the Defendant will remain on bond pending the next hearing.  
Discussion between Court and Attorneys with regard to the length of the commitment period.  
9:49 am  Court goes off the record to review Dr. Rawski's report. 

9:54 am  Court is back on the record.  Court has had a chance to review Dr. Rawski's report and summarizes the Doctor's findings for the record.   
Court understands that the parties are going to:

1)  Stipulate to Dr. Rawski's report and use that report as a basis for Mr. Scifo to be found not guilty by mental disease or defect
2)  The commitment will be under conditional release
3)  They have stipulated that the period for the commitment will be 1 year and 6 months.  

Court has plea colloquy with Mr. Scifo.  
Defendant enters a Guilty plea to the charge.  
Court finds that the defendant's plea has been made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.  
Court finds defendant guilty.  Court then finds defendant is not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect based upon the report of Dr. Rawski  
Statement by Defendant.  
Court Orders that Mr. Scifo be committed to the Dept of Health Services for a period of 1 year and 6 months.  
Court finds that conditional release will not pose a significant risk and Orders DHS prepare a Conditional Release Plan.  
Discussion between Court and parties as to whether there is a need for an Order for involuntary administration of medication.
Response by Atty Hammock that the defendant is doing what he needs to do as far as taking his meds. 
Discussion concerning any sentence credit.  Court determines defendant has no sentence credit due.

CONDITIONAL RELEASE PLAN IS ORDERED
Further hearing is set for July 20, 2016 at 2:30 p.m. (30 minutes)

10:08 am  Court in recess.
Defendant Ryan J Scifo in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Expert Witness
Attorney Rebecca Hammock appeared.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  Defendant Ryan J Scifo in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hammock advises that Dr. Rawski has been doing an evaluation of Mr. Scifo but needed additional records.  He now has those records but needs time to complete his report.  Attorney Johnson is prepared to proceed to trial and asks that it not be rescheduled.  Court will address other cases on the pre-trial calendar and come back to this.  CASE RECALLED:  Another case on the Court's calendar will be tried on Monday.  The Court bumps this case and reschedules new FPT and JT dates.  Court is also setting a status conference date to check on the doctor's evaluation.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 2:30 p.m. with a 3-day bifurcated Jury Trial scheduled for July 11, 12 and 13, 2016 at 8:30 am
